IO module¶

kibem is designed to operate on building enery (BE) databases from files such as Excel spreadsheets.

The io module offers the following functions to read databases from source files.

Function

Description

read_excel()

Reads a valid BE Excel spreadsheet.
kubem.io.read.read_be_excel(fname)¶

Reads a valid BE Excel spreadsheet.

Parameters

fname (str) – Name of file with valid BE Excel spreadsheet.

Return type

DataFrame

Returns

BE dataframe.

Raises

ValueError – If fname is not a valid Excel BE spreadsheet.

Notes

read_kbes_excel() reads a valid Excel BE spreadsheet (.xlsx) and returns a DataFrame with column names translated to English.

The validity of the spreadsheet is assessed through the expected column names. Data must be contained in a sheet named ‘Datos’, expand from column ‘A’ to ‘AA’, and start from row 3.

In addition, a year attribute will be created for the dataframe, indicating the year for the recorded monthly energy consumpion.

kubem.io.write.write_im_portfolio(dataframe, fpath='portfolio.xlsx')¶

Writes an Excel sreadsheet portfolio for inverse modeling.

Parameters

  • dataframe (DataFrame) – KBES dataframe after geocoding.

  • fpath (str) – Path to write file. Default is “portfolio.xlsx”.

Return type

None

Returns

Raises

  • ValueError – If dataframe is not a valid KBES dataframe,

  • AttributeError – If dataframe does not contain latitude or longitude columns.

Notes

This function writes the portfolio spreadsheet file requuired by the Energy Efficiency Targeting Tool to run an inverse modeling simulation for energy efficiency perfoamnce of buildings.
